ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Change to bard song mechanics on Test!
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with you Kit. It s bad. Us bards have to press buttons every 5 secs to change songs and now we ll have to continue to be chained to our desks during
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with you Kit. It's bad.

Us bards have to press buttons every 5 secs to change songs and now we'll
have to continue to be chained to our desks during downtime.

Auto-logoff would be really bad, btw. Have you ever been in a room that has
a motion sensor light? If you sit at your desk and you're reading, you have
to wave your hand in the air every 15 min or end up in the dark.

Auto-logoff is the same thing. You may be sitting reading stuff on your
screen, not necessarily pushing any buttons for 10 mins, but get booted off
just because the server thinks you're inactive. You'd have to make sure you
push a button every 10 mins or be booted. After you're booted, you'd lose
all of your no-rent items as well as any illusions you had up. I don't
think Verant would even implement such a bad thing. Uhh, maybe not. Don't
post the auto-logoff thing on the web Kit. Please! :-)

---Windleaf

At 01:25 PM 10/31/00 -0700, you wrote:
>So it's okay to go AFK for 30 minutes to meditate or chloroplast heal but
>not to Hymn? So are all caster buffs going to end when the caster logs off
>so they can't park an enchanter nearby just to clarity and log him on and
>off? Plain and simple this is stupid. It's another example of where
>probably some bard was sitting AFK on the planes and now we all have to be
>nerfed because someone abused the situation. Heaven forbid they should
>handle this by putting in an auto logoff when someone is inactive for more
>than 10 minutes like most games do.
>
> Kit
